channel.title: Donate button
channel.description: i just added a donate button in my website in 000webhost in a template and when i click on the donate button its say and i just added the donate button nothing else http://error404.000webhost.com/?

Since you really don’t know what you’re doing when it comes to html for now, just put the style.css file in the same folder as the donate.html file.[/quote]

item.title: Donate button
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

So take that and save it to a html document named ‘donate.’ Depending on your text editor, you might have to manually change the extension, which can be changed by right-clicking on the document, selecting rename, and changing it to ‘donate.html’.
Afterwards,

[quote=“Flame_, post:13, topic:532355”]Name the document ‘donate.html’ and change the # placeholder to donate.html
After you’ve done that, upload whatever files you’ve changed/added to your FTP client or file manager, and your ‘donate’ link should now work and lead to your new donate page.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Donate button
item.dc:creator: @i_pwn_u11 i_pwn_u1
item.description:
@i_pwn_u11 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:13, topic:532355”]In that case you should leave the link to ‘donate’ as #, which as I’ve said earlier doesn’t lead anywhere and acts as a placeholder.

You should find a template you like and save it to your website’s folder, under whatever directory your links are. After saving it, name the document ‘donate.html’ and change the # placeholder to donate.html
After you’ve done that, upload whatever files you’ve changed/added to your FTP client or file manager, and your ‘donate’ link should now work and lead to your new donate page.[/quote]

item.title: Donate button
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

In that case you should leave the link to ‘donate’ as #, which as I’ve said earlier doesn’t lead anywhere and acts as a placeholder.

You should find a template you like and save it to your website’s folder, under whatever directory your links are. After saving it, name the document ‘donate.html’ and change the # placeholder to donate.html
After you’ve done that, upload whatever files you’ve changed/added to your FTP client or file manager, and your ‘donate’ link should now work and lead to your new donate page.

Read full topic

item.title: Donate button
item.dc:creator: @i_pwn_u11 i_pwn_u1
item.description:
@i_pwn_u11 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:11, topic:532355”]You linked to “donate” but didn’t link the page to any actual place. You’re basically telling the browser to type “donate” in the address bar, and go. In your website files, I’m assuming you have a page called “donate.(extension).” Look for what the extension is on the file, which I’m assuming is ‘.php’ or ‘.html’.
The result:

  • Donate
    • [/quote]

    but i dont have any donation page i want to make one by 000webhost or a donating template

    Read full topic

In your website files, I’m assuming you have a page called “donate.(extension).” Look for what the extension is on the file, which I’m assuming is ‘.php’ or ‘.html’.
The result:

item.title: Donate button
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

By “button” are you referring to a link in a navigation bar? If so, that means that you’re pointing the link to an invalid/corrupt address, which is leading you to the 404 page. If you want to keep the link, yet have it as a placeholder (which means that the link won’t lead the person to anywhere and keep them on their current page if they click it), add a # where you would place a link.

Example:
Donate

Read full topic
